Summary: A 'fleet'of lights passing at low altitude over surrounding hills (Sidbury, Devon)
trends: There have been no other sightings in Sidmouth
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsat approximately 10.50pm on saturday 29th august i had just got into bed. the area i live in has no street lighting so nights are always very dark and i have yet to install curtains as i am renovating a house. i have a fantastic view across the valley and often look out before i sleep as the constellations are very clear. as i was going to bed i looked out of the window and thought it strange that a large number of stars were moving across the sky. i ran to the window and opened it to see at least 7 or 8 white\orange 'stars' following the line of the ridge know locally as east hill. the lights were moving at a reasonable speed and i watched them for at least thirty seconds or so then ran to fetch my video camera. i filmed the area as the objects moved over east hill and out of sight to the north. the only footage i have is of a very prominent background star in the area which would be of little use i am sure. although there is air traffic in the area, these were clearly not planes. they appeared to fly together although no symmetry was observed. the objects remained close at all times. there was no noise i could make out. i am very familiar with the night sky in this area and this was at the very least highly unusual. i have never experienced anything like this before and have spent long nights in the summer with the children watching shooting stars and meteor showers so we know the difference. these were low level objects which did not conform to any view i would associate normally with the night sky. i also ran outside after seeing the objects and took some footage north just to see if anything could be captured but nothing has appeared.
